column1: The House of the King was one of the Twelve Houses of the Gondothlim
column2: under the personal command of King Turgon in Gondolin.  They wore white and gold and red
column3: and their emblems the moon and the sun and the Scarlet Heart.  During the Fall of Gondolin
column4: the Kings House was untouched until all the houses were gathered again at the Square of the Palace
column5: for they had remained there during the fighting at the North Gate of Gondolin.  But after Gothmog (balrog) was slain by Ecthelion
column6: they hurled themselves upon the Orcs
column7: and even slew two score Balrogs.  They forced one of the terrible Fire-drakes into the Fountain of the King
column9: though the water did also.  But many of them were killed by the heat
column13: for the steam that rose from the fountain obscured their view.  But a body of them saved the king
column14: and there was a rally of men beneath Glingal and Belthil.  No more is said of this house
column15: but they probably perished with Turgon.
